list.name: Marksman
info: When you roll to Engage in combat with a ranged weapon at itâ€™s proper range you can choose to reroll one die.
This new result must be accepted.
This perk may only be used once per combat scenario.

list.name: Dead or Alive
info: You have the ability to deal non-lethal damage with a lethal weapon.

list.name: Squad Leader
info: When you Act Defensively in combat and roll a result of 10+ you may give yourself or one of your allies +1 to their next roll during combat.
This takes effect in the next round of combat.

list.name: Master Tactician
info: While engaged in combat you can attempt to find some weakness in your aggressor to exploit. When you choose to Act Defensively and roll a result of 10+ you grant each of your allies +1 to the result of their next roll made to engage your aggressors.
This takes effect in the next round of combat.

list.name: Black Belt
info: When you Engage in combat against an opponent at close range while wielding a melee weapon or unarmed you may choose to reroll one die.
This trait can only be used once per combat scenario.
The new result must be accepted.

list.name: Brawler
list.info: Your unarmed attacks can be lethal.

list.name: Cover Fire
info: When you Act Defensively in combat with a ranged weapon equipped and you roll a 10 + you may choose to take this action, forcing opponents to be more inaccurate in their attacks.
Doing so will halve all Damage received by other players this round (rounded up).

list.name: Die Hard
info: If you receive Damage in combat that would normally render you unconscious you can choose to keep fighting.
If you are reduced to 0 hitpoints, you still die
Any non lethal damage you receive while only having 1 hitpoint remaining will render you unconscious.

list.name: Weapons Master
info: Choose a weapon with a Range of Melee (e.g., Sword, Club, Staff, Knife, etc.). When you Engage in combat with this weapon you may choose to reroll 1 die.
This new result must be accepted.
This perk can only be used once per combat scenario.
This Perk cannot be used on the same attack roll as Black Belt.

list.name: Always Shoots First
info: So long as you are aware of your target, you cannot be Ambushed.
If a target turns hostile while you're conversing with them, you are granted the ability to Ambush them before they can act.

list.name: Combat Reflexes
list.info: When you Act Defensively, you may choose to roll + Body instead of + Wits.

action.name: Combat Reflexes
action.desc: Block, dodge, retreat, or regroup to assist an ally.

macro.success: $C safely disengages from combat OR finds a better vantage point and gains +1 to their next combat action. +1 can be passed to an ally if they're in communication.
macro.partial: $C takes no damage OR takes half damage and disengages from combat.

list.name: Grappler
info: When you roll a 10 + when Engaging with a target roughly your size in an attempt to grapple them they will become entangled and unable to attempt to escape the grapple for a number of rounds equal to your body stat.
For the following turns you can choose to (a) move the target with you; (b) knock out the target; or (c) kill the target.

list.name: Fitness Regiment
info: Gain +1 to Body.
You can take this perk up to 3 times.

list.name: Disciplined
info: Gain +1 to Wits.
You can take this perk up to 3 times.

list.name: Well Read
info: Gain +1 to Smarts.
You can take this perk up to 3 times.

list.name: Confidence Boost
info: Gain +1 to Charm.
You can take this perk up to 3 times.

list.name: Touch of the Unknown
info: Gain +1 to Strange.
You can take this perk up to 3 times.

list.name: Field Medic
info: When attempting to heal a biological target, roll + Smarts.
SUCCESS: The target heals for 2 hitpoints.
PARTIAL: The target heals for 1 hitpoint.
FAILURE: The target takes 1 additional Damage.

list.name: Doctor
info: Your study of medicine gives you the ability to treat wounds, injuries and illnesses.
You are able to treat Injuries that require a Doctor.
At the beginning of every day roll + Smarts. You gain a pool of points equal to the results.
Spend 1 point to heal a target 1 hitpoint, or spend 5 points to treat an injury or disease.
These healing points can only be spent when you have access to the necessary equipment and are in a space where you and the patient can rest.
The GM will decide how much treatment is needed to fully cure the injury or disease.

list.name: Symptomatic Sleuth
info: When attempting a Smarts roll to determine the cause of a medical symptom or cause of death, a FAILURE will instead be treated as a PARTIAL.

list.name: Can We Fix It?
info: Given the proper space, equipment, and time, you may repair gear or other devices by rolling + Smarts.
SUCCESS: The target can be restored to nearly new conditions within a day.
PARTIAL: The target can either be restored by 25% of its armor in that time frame, take up to a week to fully repair, or may require additional resources to fully restore.
FAILURE: The target is beyond your current capabilities to repair and may need to be scrapped for resources or brought to a better equipped facility.

macro.success: The device or gear can be restored to nearly new conditions within a day.
macro.partial: The target can either be restored by 25% of its armor in that time frame, take up to a week to fully repair, or may require additional resources to fully restore.
macro.failure: The target is beyond $C's current capabilities to repair. It may need to be scrapped for resources or brought to a better equipped facility.

list.name: Patch Job
info: If something becomes damaged while in the field you may attempt to patch it by rolling + Smarts.
SUCCESS: Restore 2 Armor to the object.
PARTIAL: Restore 1 Armor to the object
FAILURE: Deal 1 additional Damage to the object.

list.name: Structual Weak Points
info: When rolling to Engage a mechanical target you can choose to roll + Smarts instead of + Body.

list.name: Sabotage
info: When you choose to interact with a mechanical object, you may attempt to sabotage said object by rolling + Smarts.
SUCCESS: Sabotage is successful.
PARTIAL: Sabotage is only half-successful.
FAILURE: You fail in your attempt or get caught in the act.
Options for sabotage
Set a trap that triggers when the object is used.
Break the device (requires someone to repair it to make it function).
More specific tasks (GM's discretion).

action.name: Sabotage
action.desc: Break a mechnical object or rig it to spring a trap when used.

list.name: Upgrade
info: Attempt to upgrade a piece of gear by rolling + Smarts.
SUCCESS: You successfully modify the gear in one day.
PARTIAL: Either the process takes up to a week (during which the gear is unusable) or the upgrade is aborted.
FAILURE: You break the piece of equipment and will need to repair it before it can function again.
You can only upgrade one piece of Equipment at a time.
You can take this Perk multiple times.
You can upgrade each piece of Equipment as many times as you have taken this perk.
Potential upgrades include:
Adding 1 Shield
Adding the Insulated trait.
Adding the Incendiary, Electric, Stun, or Cold trait.
Adding 2 Armor
Removing the Loud trait

macro.partial: $C experiencese an unexpected complication upgrading the gear. They can abort the process or render the gear unusable for one week while the upgrade is in progress.
macro.failure: $C fails miserably and breaks the gear. It must be repaired before using it again.

list.name: Fast Friends
info: The first time you introduce yourself to an NPC, they will be warmer to you than they would be to the average person. Even a normally hostile NPC will give you a chance.
Additionally, you gain + 1 to the result of the first + Charm roll you make with an NPC.

list.name: A Way With Words
info: When you attempt to manipulate a person you can choose to reroll a die.
The new result must be accepted.

list.name: Great Motivator
info: You may attempt to draw inner potential from your allies by rolling + Charm.
SUCCESS: Target ally gains + 2 on a single roll of their choosing.
PARTIAL: Target ally gains + 1 on a single roll of their choosing.
FAILURE: You miss the mark and they gain no benefit.
You may attempt this ability once per ally, per day.

action.name: Motivate Ally
action.desc: Give your ally an advantage on their next roll.

macro.success: Target ally gains + 2 on a single roll.
macro.partial: Target ally gains + 1 on a single roll.

list.name: Multilingual
info: You become fluent in one additional language, becoming able to speak/read/write it.
This Perk may be taken multiple times, learning a new language each time.

list.name: I Know A Guy
info: If you find yourself in need of an object or information, you know just who to call. Roll + Charm.
SUCCESS: Your contact has what you need, or at least knows where you can get it.
PARTIAL: Your contact is willing to help but may require something in exchange.
FAILURE: Your contact either doesnâ€™t know anything or doesn't want to help.

action.name: Call A Guy
action.desc: Call somebody knowledgeable to get an object or piece of information.

macro.partial: $C's contact can help, but needs some motivation to do so.

list.name: Takes One to Know One
info: You always know when you are being lied to. You donâ€™t always know the extent of the lie, but your gut always knows.

list.name: Like A Book
info: When you roll to attempt to read a person, a FAILURE will instead be treated as a PARTIAL.

list.name: Casanova
info: If you attempt a + Charm roll on a NPC that could potentially be attracted to your PC, you can flaunt your attractive properties to gain a + 1 to your roll.

list.name: Intimidation Tactics
info: When rolling to manipulate a person, you may choose to roll + Body instead of + Charm.

action.name: Intimidation Tactics
action.desc: Convince somebody by physical threat instead of social charm.

macro.partial: Target feels uneasy, but stands firm.
macro.failure: Target isn't intimidated by $C at all.

list.name: Mimicry
info: You have the ability to mimic a voice you have heard.
When you attempt deception using this perk, you may choose to reroll 1 die.
You must accept the new result.

list.name: Smuggler
info: You have the ability to hide any object that can be held in one hand from detection on your person.

list.name: Didn't See That Coming
info: When you decide to ambush a target you are conversing with, you can choose to roll + Charm instead of + Body.

list.name: Fighting Dirty
info: When engaging a target in melee combat, you can choose to roll + Wits instead of + Body.

action.name: Fighting Dirty
action.desc: Directly confront the opponent ahead of you.

list.name: Where'd They Go
info: When you Act Defensively in a combat scenario and get a SUCCESS, you can choose to slip into an unnoticed position rather than run away entirely.
Doing so will guarantee your next combat Action results in taking no Damage no matter the result rolled.
If you choose to Engage a target from this position it is considered an Ambush.

list.name: No Such thing As Luck
info: When partaking in a game of chance (e.g., poker, slots, blackjack, etc.) you are familiar with, you can choose to use roll + any of your stats instead of just making a chance roll.
You can choose to roll + Body to use your reflexes and cheat your way to victory.
You can choose to roll + Wits to use your observation skills to outwit your opponents.
You can choose to roll + Smarts by using your brain to play the odds.
You can choose to roll + Charm by using your gift of speech or performance to gain an edge in the game.
You can choose to roll + Strange to use your otherworldly abilities to gain an edge.

list.name: Just One of Those Faces
info: You tend not to leave much of an impression. Most NPCs wonâ€™t remember you after a day or so, giving you a chance at a fresh start.
If you are attempting to evade pursuers in a crowded area, you can choose to blend in with the crowd rather than rolling to run or hide.
You can choose to remind an NPC of who you are to jog their memory.
NPCs with whom you have built a friendship or made a direct enemy will still remember you.

list.name: Mysterious Awakening: Empath
info: You sometimes can feel the emotions of those nearby. When consciously focused, you can choose to roll + Strange when attempting to get a read on a person.

list.name: Mysterious Awakening: Firestarter
info: You can manipulate small flames within 10 feet of you, enough to freely light or snuff out a candle. With a conscious effort you can turn this into an attack by rolling + Strange.

action.name: Flame Attack
action.desc: Manipulate small flames to attack a target.

macro.header: $C attacks with a burst of flames.
macro.success: Target takes damage if not immune to flames.
macro.partial: $C takes damage, and the target takes damage if not immune to fire.

list.name: Mysterious Awakening: Telekinetic
info: You can manipulate any object that weighs less than a pound within 10 feet of you. These objects are slow moving and canâ€™t be used as projectile weapons.

list.name: Telepath
info: You have the ability to communicate with any creature telepathically within 100 feet, as long as you are aware of them. By looking a target creature in the eyes you may attempt to read the creatureâ€™s surface level thoughts by rolling + Strange.
SUCCESS: You hear all surface level thoughts and the target is none the wiser.
PARTIAL: You either gain access but the target is alerted to your presence, or you fail to gain access to their thoughts.
FAILURE: You fail, your target is alerted to your presence, and blocks future attempts.

action.name: Telepath
action.desc: Read surface level thoughts of a target creature within 100 feet.

macro.partial: $C hears the target's thoughts, but the target is alerted.
macro.failure: The target is alerted and blocks future attempts.

list.name: Mind Trick
info: When attempting to manipulate a person to do a simple task, you may choose to roll + Strange instead of + Charm.
SUCCESS: The target performs the task and is none the wiser.
PARTIAL: The target performs the task, but within an hour it will quickly realize it has been tricked.
FAILURE: Nothing happens, or the target becomes aware of the psychic attack (GM discretion)
Simple tasks might include believing an obvious lie, opening a door, giving information, letting you pass, giving an item, etc.

action.name: Mind Trick
action.desc: Make a biological creature do a simple task.

macro.header: $C tries to make the target do something.
macro.partial: The target performs the task, but will soon become aware.
macro.failure: Nothing happens. The target may be aware of the psychic attack.

list.name: Mind Control
info: You can attempt to dominate the mind of a biological creature, making it your willing slave, by rolling + Strange.
SUCCESS: You gain control of the target and can issue it any command while it remains under your control.
PARTIAL: You may issue the creature one command and it will follow that order while it remains under your control.
FAILURE: You fail in your attempt to dominate the creature and it becomes aware of what you did.

action.name: Mind Control
action.desc: Dominate and enslave the mind of a biological creature.

macro.success: $C gains control of the target and can issue multiple commands until the link is broken.
macro.partial: $C gains brief control of the target and can issue one command.
macro.failure: The target is unaffected and is aware of $C's attempt.

list.name: Empowered Telekinesis
info: You can manipulate objects up to 100 lbs within 20 feet of you.
Objects up to 10 lbs require no effort; heavier objects require a roll.
If the object is a melee weapon, it can be used to attack within that range, rolling + Strange instead of + Body.
This perk may be used to push, pull or lift another character or living creature but will require a Strange roll to do so.
This perk can be taken multiple times, doubling the range and multiplying the weight increments by 5 for each additional level.
Additionally, if this ability is used to attack, add 1 Damage for each additional time this perk was taken.

action.name: Telekinetic Attack
action.desc: Attack by telekinetically controlling a distant object.

macro.header: $C tries to attack telekinetically with a distant object.

list.name: Telekinetic Barrier
info: Gain + 1 Shield.

list.name: Always Been Lucky
info: When you Act Defensively, you can choose to roll + Strange instead of + Wits.

list.name: Driver
info: While operating any land vehicle, you have the following benefits:
Any land vehicle you operate has + 1 Shield.
You may choose to roll either + Body or + Wits for any maneuvers made to operate the vehicle (racing, stunts, attacking a target with the vehicle, etc)

list.name: Pilot
info: You have the ability to operate aircraft.

list.name: Animal Whisperer
info: You have the ability to befriend beasts as you could any other NPC. Additionally, the first time you attempt a charm roll to manipulate a beast, you can choose to reroll one of the dice. You must accept the new result.
